channel.title: reidlewis tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from reidlewis.

item.description:
1/ Here’s my roundup 4 new space stations aka #CommercialLEO Destinations

@AxiomSpace #AxiomSegment - launch 2024 @NanoRacks #Starlab - launch 2027 #NorthrupGrumman Commercial Space Station #NGCSS - launch TBA @BlueOrigin #OrbitalReef - launch 2027

https://t.co/5qjM0fBqr2
@davewiner Please add “Text to speech” to the backlog as many of us would love to “listen to unread Tweets”
item.source:markdown: @davewiner Please add “Text to speech” to the backlog as many of us would love to “listen to unread Tweets”

item.description:
Here's my roundup of #launchcapacity to #LEO for planned #HLV rockets

#Ariane6 22K kg - 47K lb #NewGlenn 45K kg - 99K lb #SLS 95K kg - 209K lb #Starship 100K kg - 220K lb #ULAVulcan/ #Centaur 25K kg - 56K lb

Sources: Wikipedia HLV, SLS & StarShip pages https://t.co/JAIYbunx6j
item.source:markdown:
Here's my roundup of #launchcapacity to #LEO for planned #HLV rockets
#Ariane6 22K kg - 47K lb #NewGlenn 45K kg - 99K lb #SLS 95K kg - 209K lb #Starship 100K kg - 220K lb #ULAVulcan/ #Centaur 25K kg - 56K lb
Sources: Wikipedia HLV, SLS & StarShip pages https://t.co/JAIYbunx6j

item.description:
@HarrisonAdAstra @StarshipGazer @SpaceX @elonmusk Doh! Thanks for your correction!

That means 33 + 6 = 39 needed per full stack of #spacexstarship & #spacexbooster so, with 86 confirmed produced, there's room for two full stacks with an allowance for at least 8 lost during testing.
item.source:markdown:
@HarrisonAdAstra @StarshipGazer @SpaceX @elonmusk Doh! Thanks for your correction!
That means 33 + 6 = 39 needed per full stack of #spacexstarship & #spacexbooster so, with 86 confirmed produced, there's room for two full stacks with an allowance for at least 8 lost during testing.

item.description:
@StarshipGazer @SpaceX @elonmusk Thanks for capturing #spacexraptor2 numbers 86, 85, 53, 47, 41 & 34

Since each #spacexstarship stack requires 9 + 33 = 42, it seems that enough have been produced for 2 stacks of starship + #spacexbooster (84), although some likely lost in testing & in the 11 July 2022 anomaly
item.source:markdown:
@StarshipGazer @SpaceX @elonmusk Thanks for capturing #spacexraptor2 numbers 86, 85, 53, 47, 41 & 34
Since each #spacexstarship stack requires 9 + 33 = 42, it seems that enough have been produced for 2 stacks of starship + #spacexbooster (84), although some likely lost in testing & in the 11 July 2022 anomaly

item.description:
@StarshipGazer @SpaceX @elonmusk Thanks for capturing the serial number of #spacexraptor2 #81 !!

Each fully stacked #spacexstarship needs 9 Raptor engines + #spacexbooster needs 33 Raptors.

Read more here: https://t.co/1H9hLKTj0F

Looking back in time at a plan for the #hohmanntransfer window for #mars #2022

https://t.co/LB5VSyaTAX

Illustration of Hohmann transfer orbit

Leafnode - Own work based on image by Hubert Bartkowiak CC BY-SA 2.5view terms File:Hohmann transfer orbit.svg Created: 3.04.2007 https://t.co/9j6vrJw24S https://t.co/aKDAq8tyfB

item.description:
1/ Here's my roundup of #wenhop for #HLV rockets

Ariane 6 “sometime in 2023” New Glenn “the runway is closing on 2022” SLS “could launch as early as August 29th” Starship “a successful orbital flight is probably between 1 and 12 months from now” Vulcan “Slipping into 2023”

2/ FYI, learn about #HLV rockets here

https://t.co/JAIYbunx6j

3/ #Ariane6 “sometime in 2023” https://t.co/7yXbADuKJX

4/ #NewGlenn “The runway is closing on 2022,” Jones said . . .but its premature to announce it. “It will not be at the end of this year,” he acknowledged. https://t.co/3vLKY2XKSS

5/ #SLS “could launch as early as August 29th” https://t.co/7HeU3RnlFI

6/ #Starship “A successful orbital flight is probably between 1 and 12 months from now” https://t.co/C8RJG0E8Xv

7/ #ULAVulcan “Slipping into 2023” https://t.co/LKH2Ti7g5R
item.source:markdown:
1/ Here's my roundup of #wenhop for #HLV rockets
Ariane 6 “sometime in 2023” New Glenn “the runway is closing on 2022” SLS “could launch as early as August 29th” Starship “a *successful* orbital flight is probably between 1 and 12 months from now” Vulcan “Slipping into 2023”
2/ FYI, learn about #HLV rockets here
https://t.co/JAIYbunx6j
3/ #Ariane6 “sometime in 2023” https://t.co/7yXbADuKJX
4/ #NewGlenn “The runway is closing on 2022,” Jones said . . .but its premature to announce it. “It will not be at the end of this year,” he acknowledged. https://t.co/3vLKY2XKSS
5/ #SLS “could launch as early as August 29th” https://t.co/7HeU3RnlFI
6/ #Starship “A *successful* orbital flight is probably between 1 and 12 months from now” https://t.co/C8RJG0E8Xv
7/ #ULAVulcan “Slipping into 2023” https://t.co/LKH2Ti7g5R

item.description:
Re-learning from @iftf terms from my #Economics major @DukeU @DukeEcon

A monopsony is a market structure in which a single buyer substantially controls the market as the major purchaser of goods & services offered by many would-be sellers

https://t.co/iODqcW6uTD

Not a fun game https://t.co/wusfZhkTBJ
item.source:markdown:
Re-learning from @iftf terms from my #Economics major @DukeU @DukeEcon
